title: Environmental Monitoring Method Vocabulary
description: Controlled vocabulary for methods used to monitor environmental conditions, emissions, and impacts.

terms.label: Continuous Instrument Monitoring
terms.definition: Continuous measurement using installed instruments, such as continuous emissions monitoring systems (CEMS) or automated sensors.

terms.label: Manual Sampling and Laboratory Analysis
terms.definition: Manual collection of samples followed by laboratory analysis, often on a periodic basis.

terms.label: Remote Sensing
terms.definition: Monitoring using remote sensing technologies, such as satellite or aerial imagery, lidar, or radiometric measurements.

terms.label: Model-based Estimation
terms.definition: Estimation of environmental metrics using models, emission factors, or activity data rather than direct measurement.

terms.label: Citizen Science or Community Monitoring
terms.definition: Monitoring conducted by community groups or volunteers using recognized protocols or tools.

terms.label: Other Monitoring Method
terms.definition: A monitoring method that does not fit another, more specific category in this vocabulary.
